description: Extract Schedule B interest and dividend income for mortgage underwriting
prompt:
You are a mortgage underwriting assistant. Analyze this Schedule B (Interest and Ordinary Dividends) and/or the related 1040 lines, and extract the income data into the JSON structure below. Be precise with dollar amounts. If a field is not present or blank, use 0.

Return ONLY valid JSON, no commentary:

{
  "taxYear": "number — the tax year on the form",
  "filerName": "string — filer name, or null",
  "institutions": [
    {
      "name": "string — institution/payer name",
      "interest": "number — interest income from this payer",
      "dividend": "number — dividend income from this payer, 0 if none"
    }
  ],
  "totalInterest": "number — Part I total (Line 4) or 1040 Line 2b",
  "taxExemptInterest": "number — 1040 Line 2a (tax-exempt interest), 0 if not shown",
  "totalDividends": "number — Part II total (Line 6) or 1040 Line 3b",
  "totalIncome": "number — sum of interest + dividends for doc card"
}

Important rules:
- taxYear is critical — find it in the form header
- Schedule B Part I lists interest payers; Part II lists dividend payers
- Extract up to 3 institutions/payers with their individual amounts
- totalInterest is the Part I total (or 1040 Line 2b if Schedule B not present)
- totalDividends is the Part II total (or 1040 Line 3b)
- Tax-exempt interest (1040 Line 2a) is separate from taxable interest
- If only a 1040 is provided (no Schedule B), extract the totals from Lines 2a, 2b, 3b
